decks.notes: The main concept of this Affinity deck is to quickly swarm the board with cheap artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Memnite, while buffing them with equipment like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Galvanic Blast for additional ways to close out the game quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy that can be difficult to stop once it gets going.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. By constantly attacking with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also casting efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. This aggressive strategy puts pressure on the opponent from the early turns of the game, forcing them to react quickly or risk losing before they can stabilize. With a low mana curve and high amount of direct damage spells, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with speed and efficiency.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with spells using cards like Thought Scour, Faithless Looting, and Manamorphose to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for massive damage. It also utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Thing in the Ice to control the board and protect its threats. The deck focuses on rapid damage output and card advantage through efficient spells and powerful creatures like Crackling Drake. It combines burn spells like Lightning Bolt and removal like Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on using a variety of artifacts to control the opponent's board state and disrupt their strategy, while also efficiently searching for key pieces with cards like Whir of Invention and Ancient Stirrings. Ensnaring Bridge and Chalice of the Void provide defense against creature-based strategies, while Engineered Explosives offers flexible removal options. Crucible of Worlds allows for recurring land destruction with Tectonic Edge, while Academy Ruins can retrieve key artifacts. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on using the Amulet of Vigor to generate large amounts of mana early in the game, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan. It utilizes land bounce effects like Simic Growth Chamber and bounce lands for maximum ramp potential. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and either win by attacking with Primeval Titan or setting up a lethal Walking Ballista. The deck has strong consistency due to its tutors and card draw spells, making it a powerful and versatile combo deck in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Creeping Chill, Stinkweed Imp, and Faithless Looting, in order to trigger powerful graveyard-based abilities such as Dredge. By continuously dredging cards back from the graveyard and using cards like Life from the Loam to keep the engine going, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of creatures and burn spells like Conflagrate. This deck aims to efficiently utilize the graveyard as a resource to build a strong board presence and generate repeatable value.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively cast a combination of cheap spells and creatures to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal damage to the opponent. Faithless Looting helps with card selection and filling the graveyard, while cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear provide early pressure. Bedlam Reveler can help refill your hand later in the game. The spells in the deck are focused on dealing direct damage to the opponent, with Lightning Bolt, Skewer the Critics, Lava Spike, and Gut Shot being key components.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a strong board presence with aggressive Human creatures while disrupting the opponent with cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant to boost the team's power and toughness. The mana base is designed to support the diverse casting requirements of the Human creatures, ensuring a smooth and consistent gameplay experience. Overall, the deck focuses on applying early pressure and maintaining tempo to secure victory.

The main concept of this Aggro deck is to generate value through +1/+1 counters and artifact synergy, using cards like Hardened Scales, Arcbound Ravager, and Hangarback Walker to overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on fast creature deployment and efficient removal spells like Dismember to maintain board control. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and lands that support the theme of +1/+1 counters and synergies, this deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence and push for a fast victory in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble UrzaTron (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows for powerful plays such as casting spells like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, Ulamog, and Ugin. The deck also includes utility lands like Sanctum of Ugin and Ghost Quarter to disrupt opponents' strategies. Control elements like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone help manage the opponent's graveyard and board state. The deck aims to control the game with powerful threats and removal spells while leveraging UrzaTron's mana advantage.

The focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a significant amount of mana quickly, allowing for powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated to be played ahead of schedule. The deck also includes artifact-based ramp cards like Expedition Map, Chromatic Star, and Sylvan Scrying to ensure the Tron lands are assembled efficiently. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to control the board and outlast opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana to play powerful threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck uses control elements like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Oblivion Stone to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Expedition Map to find the Tron lands and key pieces of the deck quickly and efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence with efficient artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Ensoul Artifact to enhance their attacking power. Stubborn Denial provides protection for key threats, while Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager help pump up the team. The deck is also able to generate additional value with cards like Sai, Master Thopterist and Walking Ballista. The mana base is optimized to support the artifact-centric strategy and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use Jeskai Ascendancy to untap creatures and generate mana while also digging for combo pieces. This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with spells and creatures like Arclight Phoenix and Young Pyromancer to generate a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to facilitate this strategy, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile for disruption and protection. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game through explosive turns.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and out-value the opponent. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, along with efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict. Card draw and manipulation cards like Serum Visions and Opt help the player find answers and threats when needed. The deck also includes win conditions in the form of Celestial Colonnade and Search for Azcanta to close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam with Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck, ultimately winning the game by casting Lightning Storm or Laboratory Maniac. Using fast mana sources like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, the deck aims to control the game through counterspells like Pact of Negation while setting up the combo pieces. Phyrexian Unlife buys time against aggressive decks, allowing the deck to safely set up and execute the combo. The deck is designed to win quickly and efficiently in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.
